importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication marks the announcement of Pakistan's first hyperspectral satellite launch, signaling a major advancement in the nation's space capabilities.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The two-month calibration period following launch places the satellite's full operational status in the second half of 2025, indicating a timeline for technology integration and utility deployment.

keyTakeAways: Pakistan has launched its first hyperspectral satellite, H1, marking a significant milestone in its space program.
The satellite was launched from China's Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre on October 19, 2025, by Pakistan's space agency SUPARCO.
Hyperspectral imaging enables detection of subtle material and chemical changes on Earth, useful for agriculture, water resource monitoring, and disaster response.
The satellite is expected to improve national capabilities in precision agriculture, environmental monitoring, urban planning, and disaster management.
The mission supports Pakistan’s broader development goals, including the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC), by enhancing geohazard risk identification.
The launch reflects a deepening strategic partnership between Pakistan and China in peaceful space exploration.
Two other satellites (EO-1 and KS-1) have already been successfully launched and are fully operational.
It may take about two months to calibrate the H1 satellite before it becomes fully operational.
SUPARCO chairman Muhammad Yousuf Khan stated the satellite will revolutionize agricultural productivity and climate resilience.

namedEntities.name: Pakistan
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A country in South Asia that has launched its first hyperspectral satellite, H1, as part of a national space program.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Pakistan is the subject of the article, as it is the nation launching and utilizing the satellite to advance national development and space capabilities.

namedEntities.name: SUPARCO
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The Space Research and Development Agency of Pakistan, responsible for the launch and operations of the H1 satellite.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: SUPARCO is the key organizing and implementing agency behind the satellite launch and national space program development.

namedEntities.name: H1 satellite
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Pakistan’s first hyperspectral satellite, launched into orbit on October 19, 2025.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: H1 is the central technological achievement of the article, with applications in agriculture, environmental monitoring, and disaster management.

namedEntities.name: Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A space launch facility in China’s northwest, where Pakistan’s H1 satellite was launched.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The launch site highlights international collaboration, as Pakistan used China’s launch infrastructure to deploy its satellite.

namedEntities.name: China
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation that hosted and facilitated the launch of Pakistan’s H1 satellite via its Jiuquan launch centre.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: China’s role as the launch site underscores the strategic space partnership between Pakistan and China.

namedEntities.name: China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An infrastructure development initiative linking China’s Xinjiang province to Pakistan’s Gwadar Port.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The H1 satellite’s ability to monitor geohazards supports CPEC’s development by improving risk assessment and planning.

namedEntities.name: Muhammad Yousuf Khan
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Chairman of SUPARCO, who commented on the satellite’s potential impact.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He provides official insight into the satellite’s expected societal and economic benefits, such as improved agriculture and climate resilience.

namedEntities.name: EO-1 and KS-1 satellites
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Two other satellites launched by Pakistan this year, both already operational in orbit.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They show that Pakistan’s space program is expanding and progressing beyond a single mission, indicating broader technological growth.

namedEntities.name: Precision agriculture
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A method of farming that uses data to optimize crop yields and resource use.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The H1 satellite is expected to support precision agriculture through detailed crop quality and soil analysis.

namedEntities.name: Environmental monitoring
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The process of tracking environmental conditions such as pollution and deforestation.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The satellite enables real-time detection of environmental changes, contributing to sustainability efforts.

namedEntities.name: Disaster management
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The process of responding to natural disasters like floods or earthquakes.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hyperspectral imaging allows early detection of disaster damage, improving response times and preparedness.

namedEntities.name: Water resource management
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The monitoring and efficient use of water in agriculture and urban settings.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The satellite enables precise tracking of water quality and availability, critical in arid regions like Pakistan.

namedEntities.name: Geohazard risk identification
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The detection of natural risks such as landslides or earthquakes.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This capability supports infrastructure development, especially in regions vulnerable to natural disasters.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Pakistan has successfully launched its first hyperspectral satellite, H1, from China’s Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre, marking a major advancement in its space program. The satellite, developed by SUPARCO, is designed to detect subtle material changes on Earth, enabling improved precision in agriculture, environmental monitoring, urban planning, and disaster management. It is expected to support national development goals such as the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) by enhancing geohazard risk identification. While the satellite will require about two months of calibration before full operation, it is part of a broader trend of Pakistan’s space ambitions, which includes already operational satellites EO-1 and KS-1. The mission underscores the strategic partnership between Pakistan and China in peaceful space exploration and technology transfer.
title: Pakistan launches its first hyperspectral satellite
